py_sim.sensors.range_bearing module¶

range_bearing.py Provides functions for calculating the range bearing sensor readings to emulate lidar

class py_sim.sensors.range_bearing.RangeBearingSensor(n_lines: int, max_dist: float)¶

Bases: object

Class that stores the variables needed for calculating a range bearing measurement and interpreting those

readings with respect to the vehicle

n_lines¶

Number of lines in the sensor class

Type:

int

max_dist¶

Maximum distance that each sensor can see

Type:

float

ind_left¶

Stores indices for sensors on the left of the vehicle

Type:

list[int]

ind_right¶

Stores indices for sensors on the right of the vehicle

Type:

list[int]

ind_front¶

Stores indices for sensors on the front of the vehicle

Type:

list[int]

ind_rear¶

Stores indices for sensors on the rear of the vehicle

Type:

list[int]

orien¶

Array of orientations for each of the sensors on the body

Type:

NDArray[Any]

delta¶

The angle difference between two lines of measurement

calculate_range_bearing_measurement(pose: LocationStateType, world: PolygonWorld) → RangeBearingMeasurements¶

Calculates the range / bearing measurements given the current pose of the vehicle

Parameters:

  • pose – Position. If also has orientation (UnicycleStateProtocol) then orientation used to calculate the bearing

  • world – Polygon world in which the vehicle is operating

Returns:

Measurements given the vehicle pose and polygon world

Return type:

RangeBearingMeasurements

create_measurement_from_range(pose: LocationStateType, ranges: list[float]) → RangeBearingMeasurements¶

Calculate the measurement given the position and ranges
